senses.de: A small change made to something to correct or improve it
senses.ex: The mechanic made some minor adjustments to the engine.

Tips.title: Subtle Tweaks
Tips.description: Refers to fine-tuning, often in practical or mechanical contexts; not major overhauls.
Tips.example: He made an adjustment to his bike's gears for a smoother ride.

Tips.title: Frequent Usage
Tips.description: Commonly used in everyday scenarios, from adjusting clothes to tweaking plans.
Tips.example: I need to make an adjustment to my schedule to attend the meeting.

senses.de: The adaptation or settling to new conditions
senses.ex: It took her a while to make the adjustment to living in a new country.

Tips.title: Personal Change
Tips.description: Often reflects a personal process, like adapting to a new job or lifestyle.
Tips.example: The adjustment to college life was challenging at first.

Tips.title: Time Factor
Tips.description: Implies a period of transition and might require time for someone to adapt.
Tips.example: The adjustment period for the new software could take several weeks.

senses.de: A settlement of a dispute or claim
senses.ex: They reached an adjustment of their differences out of court.

Tips.title: Conflict Resolution
Tips.description: In legal contexts, it often means resolving disagreements or claims.
Tips.example: After negotiations, the parties made an adjustment to the contract terms.

Tips.title: Compromise Involved
Tips.description: Suggests a mutual concession or change agreed upon by all involving parties.
Tips.example: The insurance company offered an adjustment in the claim settlement.

senses.ex: At the end of the fiscal year, all accounts need an adjustment.

Tips.title: Financial Reconciliation
Tips.description: In accounting, it means updating records to reflect accuracy and truthfulness.
Tips.example: The accounts needed an adjustment after the auditing discrepancies were found.

Tips.title: Precision
Tips.description: Reflects the accuracy needed in financial reporting and analysis.
Tips.example: Regular adjustment of the budget ensures financial goals remain on track.

Adaptation.wordDefinition:
Adaptation means changing to fit into a new situation or environment. For example, a cactus has adapted to living in the desert by storing water in its leaves.

Adaptation is about changing to fit in a new situation, and adjustment is about making small changes to an existing situation.

Adaptation is more applicable when dealing with major changes, while adjustment is more applicable when dealing with minor changes.

Alignment.wordDefinition:
Alignment refers to the process of positioning two or more things so that they are in the correct relationship to one another.

Adjustment involves fine-tuning or tweaking something to make it work better, while alignment involves making sure that two or more things are properly positioned or oriented relative to one another.

Alteration.wordDefinition: Alteration means making significant changes or modifications to something to transform it into something else. It is applicable when something needs major changes to change its appearance or function.

Arrangement.wordDefinition:
Arrangement refers to the way in which things are organized or put together, often in a broader sense. For example, arranging furniture in a room or arranging a meeting time with a group of people.

Adjustment relates to making specific changes to improve or correct something, while arrangement relates to the organization or putting together of things in a broader sense.

Calibration.wordDefinition:
Adjustment and calibration are both terms used to modify an instrument or tool to achieve accuracy.

Calibration is a more technical term and refers to comparing the reading of an instrument to a standard value. It is the process of adjusting an instrument to produce accurate and reliable results that can be compared with other measurements.

Calibration is particularly necessary for scientific instruments, medical equipment, and other precision tools that have to be accurate to a high degree.

Adjustment is applicable when an instrument needs to be modified to perform better or function properly, while calibration is applicable when an instrument needs to be standardized against a reference value to ensure accurate measurement.

Correction.wordDefinition:
Correction refers to fixing an error or mistake that has been made. For example, correcting a math problem that was originally calculated incorrectly.

Both terms can be applicable in various situations, but adjustment refers to making improvements to something that is already functioning, while correction refers to fixing something that is not functioning correctly.

Modification.wordDefinition:
Adjustment and modification are similar in meaning, but their usage depends on the context.

Modification means making a bigger change to something, often to alter its function or appearance. For example, if you buy a new car and want to modify the engine to make it faster, you would make significant changes to the engine to increase its speed.

Adjustment is used when making minor changes to something, whereas modification is used when making significant changes to something.

Rectification.wordDefinition:
Rectification means correcting or making right something that is wrong.

For example, rectifying an error in a financial statement by reviewing and correcting it is a rectification.

Adjustment is more for small changes, while rectification is for big corrections.

quotes.Text: Performing is something that has really grown on me and become an important part of my life, which I didn't used to feel. I didn't used to want to really perform live a lot. It's been an interesting adjustment.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Frankie Cosmos

quotes.Text: Utah has benefited from setting smart tax policy. That said, public finding is dynamic enough that we cannot just set the tax policy and presume that it does not require continual review and adjustment.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Gary Herbert

quotes.Text: I support adjustments designed to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of regulation without sacrificing safety and soundness or undermining macroprudential goals.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Jerome Powell

quotes.Text: I had to make some adjustments from what my life was like before I was a mom. My kids are so fun and loving, but they are also demanding!

quotes.Name: Gisele Bundchen

quotes.Text: Game management, game decisions, adjustments, seeing things during games - it's all important.
quotes.Title: American Coach
quotes.Name: Bill Belichick

quotes.Text: Life is the continuous adjustment of internal relations to external relations.
quotes.Title: English Philosopher
quotes.Name: Herbert Spencer

quotes.Text: Insanity - a perfectly rational adjustment to an insane world.
quotes.Title: Scottish Psychologist
quotes.Name: R. D. Laing

quotes.Text: Happiness comes from... some curious adjustment to life.
quotes.Title: New Zealander Writer
quotes.Name: Hugh Walpole

quotes.Text: Every new adjustment is a crisis in self-esteem.

quotes.Name: Eric Hoffer

quotes.Text: Life in the NFL is an adjustment.

quotes.Name: Sean McDermott
